intro: Acmella brachyglossa, commonly known as the narrow-lipped spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers surrounded by vibrant red bracts. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has a low-growing, herbaceous habit. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a slightly succulent texture. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking floral display.
